VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The owner can use recoverERC20() as a backdoor to retrieve rewardsToken.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change the function to transfer tokens to a specified address instead of the owner

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Improper reward balance checks can make some users unable to withdraw their rewards.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change the function to addReward() and use transferFrom() to transfer rewardsToken into the contract

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The StakingRewards contract allows the owner to sweep the rewards tokens, which can be used as a way to rug depositors.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add an additional check to ensure that the rewards token cannot be withdrawn

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The reward rate can be dragged out and diluted.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Consider not extending the reward payouts by rewardsDuration on every call. periodFinish probably shouldn't change at all, the rewardRate should just increase by rewardRate += reward / (periodFinish block.timestamp). Alternatively, consider keeping the rewardRate constant but extend periodFinish time by += reward / rewardRate.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Transfer to treasury can register as succeeded when failing in _calcRewardIntegral.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Ensure that the reward.token being a nonRevertingOnError. Mitigation can be attained by either refactoring or by ensuring that the first deposit is big enough (18 decimals) to keep numbers to rational values.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: staking rewards notifyRewardAmount will be inoperable if rewardsDuration is set to zero or too small or too big.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Check for min and max range in the rewardsDuration setter

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: When calling ConvexStakingWrapper.deposit(), ConvexStakingWrapper.withdraw(), StakingRewards.stake(), StakingRewards.withdraw(), the concur rewards belongs to all the users of ConvexStakingWrapper / StakingRewards will be sent to the caller wrongfully.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add two new functions to MasterChef: depositFor() and withdrawFor(). ConvexStakingWrapper, StakingRewards can utilize these two functions and get the accounting right.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Risk of fund locked, due to discrepancy between curveLP token value against internal contract math.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Price the user contribution based on the LP tokens or have people deposit the LP token directly

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: USDMPegRecovery.sol#withdraw() may often fail due to insufficient funds in the balance.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Call usdm3crv.remove_liquidity_one_coin() when the balance is insufficient for the user's withdrawal

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The current implementation of USDMPegRecovery.sol#provide() can fail when the balance of pool3 is less than usdm.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change the provide function to use the minimum balance of usdm and pool3 tokens

VulnerabilityDesc.Type: USDM locked unless guardian remove liquidity
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: USDM deposits are locked until guardian remove liquidity because there are no mechanism to remove deposited USDM in withdraw.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Refactor the contract to transform it into a Yield Bearing Vault and denominate the deposit token in the CRV_LP token to avoid issues with Single Sided Exposure

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: USDMPegRecovery.provide() will fail if there is an excess of usdm tokens.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Modify the provide function such that a _steps argument can be supplied

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Deposits and withdraws will frequently be disabled if a token that doesn't allow zero value transfers will be added as a reward one.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Check the reward before doing transfer

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Users will lose rewards if the shelter mechanism is enacted before a recent checkpoint.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Consider allowing users to call a public facing _checkpoint function once their funds have been drained to the Shelter.sol contract. This should ensure they receive their fair share of rewards. Careful consideration needs to be made when designing this mechanism, as by giving users full control of the _checkpoint function may allow them to continue receiving rewards after they have withdrawn their LP tokens.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: ConvexStakingWrapper._calcRewardIntegral() Can Be Manipulated To Steal Tokens From Other Pools.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Consider redesigning this mechanism such that all pools have their getReward function called in _checkpoint. The _calcRewardIntegral function can then ensure that each pool is allocated only a fraction of the total rewards instead of the change in contract balance. Other implementations might be more ideal, so it is important that careful consideration is taken when making these changes.

VulnerabilityDesc.Type: Wrong implementation can disrupt rewards calculation and distribution
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The implementation of _calcRewardIntegral can be broken in multiple ways, which can cause rewards to be frozen in the contract and fail transactions.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Compare the balanceOf reward token before and after getReward() to get the actual rewarded amount, and remove reward.remaining

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: ConvexStakingWrapper.enterShelter() may erroneously overwrite amountInShelter leading to locked tokens.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add to the amountInShelter mapping instead of overwriting it altogether

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: ConvexStakingWrapper#deposit() depositors may lose their funds when the _amount is huge.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add an upper limit for the _amount parameter

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Above line calls poolInfo of crvRewards which causes revert.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change L238 to IRewardStaking(convexBooster).poolInfo(_pid).lptoken

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: LP tokens are not restaked in the pool, causing LP tokens to be stuck within the contract. Users will be unable to withdraw their LP tokens as the withdraw function attempts to withdrawAndUnwrap LP tokens from the staking pool.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Re-deposit LP tokens upon calling exitShelter

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The reward tokens are transferred before the balances are set to 0, making it possible to perform a reentrancy attack if the reward token has some kind of callback functionality.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Use a nonReentrant modifier, set balances to 0 first before disbursing the rewards

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: When adding a new token pool for staking in MasterChef contract, all other already added pools should be updated but currently they are not.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Update all existing pools before adding new pool. Use the massUpdate() function which is already present ... but unused.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: totalAllocPoint can only increase, causing rewards to get diluted.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add functionality for removing pool or functionality for setting pool's totalAllocPoint param

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Users won't be able to receive any Concur rewards from MasterChef.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Create a receipt token to represent the invested token and use the receipt tokens in MasterChef

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Owner can steal Concur rewards by adding a depositor and inflating other depositors' assigned balance of the token within the contract.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Do not allow the owner to add depositors after the depositors have been configured

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Owner can remove a depositor, and depositor's reward cannot be withdrawn then.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Remove onlyDepositor modifier from the withdraw function

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: During stake or deposit, users would not be transferred the correct Concur token, when MasterChef has under-supply of it.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add a require statement to the safeConcurTransfer function to check if the balance is zero

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Deposit fees are not credited to anyone, leading to permanent lockups of deposit fees in the relevant depositor contracts.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Shift the deposit fee logic out of the masterchef contract into the depositor contracts themselves, or transfer the fee to a feeReceiver or add a way to pull those fees.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: A depositor can deposit an arbitrary amount without any cost, allowing a malicious/compromised depositor to take the majority share of all pools.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Remove the depositor role or use a more complicated architecture to prevent a malicious/compromised depositor from taking the majority share of all pools.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: If a pool has not recently updated itself and has reached the block.number = endBlock statement in updatePool, then any rewards that it would normally be entitled to prior to reaching endBlock will not be attributed to the pool.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Ensure that once the block.number = endBlock statement has been reached, the pool.accConcurPerShare is updated to reflect the number of blocks that have passed up until endBlock

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Token fee in MasterChef can be set to more than 100%, causing all deposit calls to fail due to underflow on subtraction when reward is lowered by the fee.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Set a maximum limit for the fee, which should be no more than 100%

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The claimed mapping is updated with the _to address, not the msg.sender address, allowing any user to withdraw all the funds from the shelter.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change the _to to msg.sender

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Shelter contract can steal user tokens by allowing the client to repeatedly call activate to prevent anyone from withdrawing the tokens.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Avoid activate twice for the same token and donate only after the GRACE_PERIOD

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: onlyClient can deactivate a token even after deadline is passed and transfer all token balance to itself.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add a condition to the activate function to check if the token is already activated

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Repeated calls to Shelter.withdraw can drain all funds in Shelter.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add a check to withdraw function that msg.sender has not withdrawn this token before and record that msg.sender has withdrawn the token

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The last person to withdraw will not be able to as withdraw uses a share computation for the entire savedTokens[_token] amount.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: In donate, add only the actual transferred amounts (computed by post-transfer balance pre-transfer balance) to savedTokens[_token]

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: It will be possible to increase savedTokens[_token], and thus new user claim amounts will increase after some users might already have withdrawn their shares.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add a check in donate function to not allow new deposits after the grace period ends

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: If the staking token exists in both StakingRewards.sol and ConvexStakingWrapper.sol, it will be possible to continue claiming Concur rewards after the shelter has been activated, effectively allowing users to claim double the amount of Concur rewards they should be receiving.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Ensure that staking tokens cannot be deposited in both the StakingRewards.sol and ConvexStakingWrapper.sol contracts. If this is intended behaviour, it may be worthwhile to ensure that the sheltered users have their deposited balance wiped from the MasterChef.sol contract upon being sheltered.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: If the shelter mechanism is enacted before users are able to claim their Concur rewards, any accrued tokens will be lost and the MasterChef.sol contract will continue to allocate tokens to the sheltered pool which will be forever locked within this contract.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Consider removing sheltered pools from the MasterChef.sol Concur token distribution and ensure massUpdatePools is called before making any changes to the list of pools

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Donated tokens cannot be recovered if a shelter is deactivated before the grace period has passed.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Allocate donated LP tokens to the contract owner when a shelter is deactivated by checking for an excess of LP tokens. Anything greater than amountInShelter can be considered as donated.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: execute will revert when msg.value is not greater than 0.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add payable mutability specifier to the execute function
